FuncDef:
The accounting-service-policy command configures the user traffic to match a DAA service policy.
By default, user traffic is enabled to match a DAA service policy.
CLIs: accounting-service-policy { inbound | outbound } { enable | disable | auto }

ParaDef.Info:
Enables user traffic from to match a DAA service policy.
-

Disables user traffic from matching a DAA service policy.
-

Automatically matches user traffic with a DAA service policy.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To implement refined control over DAA functions and save DAA QoS resources, for example, run the accounting-service-policy inbound disable command to disable upstream DAA user traffic from matching a DAA service policy, preventing upstream QoS resource application.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
After the accounting-service-policy { inbound | outbound } auto command is run, the system can intelligently determine whether to match upstream or downstream user traffic with a DAA service policy based on a configured service bandwidth. If no bandwidth is configured for all upstream or downstream user traffic, the system disables the user traffic from matching a DAA service policy and does not apply for upstream or downstream DAA QoS resources.
